snippet: The Swiss rider Fabian Cancellara voluntarily pulled out of the Tour de France on Tuesday, a rest day, and Vincenzo Nibali of Italy played down his status as the overall leader.
abstract: Tour de France continues to lose riders, both to crashes and voluntary withdrawals, raising questions as to whether organizers went too far in trying to liven up first week of race with difficult routes; Vincenzo Nibali holds lead.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss rider Fabian Cancellara voluntarily pulled out of the Tour de France on Tuesday, a rest day, and Vincenzo Nibali of Italy played down his status as the overall leader.

headline.seo: Tour de France 2014: Vincenzo Nibali Sizes Up Remaining Competition
headline.main: Race of Attrition Continues, Even on a Rest Day
headline.print_headline: The Tour of Attrition Continues, Even on a Rest Day
